thumb.name: Nativity Scene
thumb.verse: Kids are sure to have fun and also learn about the real %26#147;reason for the season%26#148; by creating this multi-piece. 3-D Nativity set. So cute. it%26#146;s a perfect keepsake your family can cherish and set up every year at Christmastime!%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EYou'll need:%3C/B%3E%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E Paper. 8 1/2 x 11 inches. Scissors. Tape. Foam tape.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3COL%3E%3CLI%3EClick on %3CB%3EPersonalize and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Creative workspace. %3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CLI%3EClick %3Cb%3EPrint Project%3C/b%3E to send finished %3Cb%3ENativity%3C/b%3E pages to the printer.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3ECut%3C/b%3E along solid lines to cut out every figure.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CLI%3ETo assemble figures. %3Cb%3Efold back%3C/b%3E bands at the dotted lines.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3ETape or glue%3C/b%3E the ends of the bands together to form a stand.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EAttach%3C/b%3E the star to the upper right side of the barn using foam tape.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EAttach%3C/b%3E the angel to the upper left side of the barn using foam tape.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EArrange%3C/b%3E figures as desired. to create the nativity scene.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3C/LI%3E%3C/OL%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E %3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPrint your project on scrap paper first to check the alignment. spelling. and overall look of the project.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3EPlace completed nativity scene on a fireplace mantel or other solid. flat surface or table that%26#146;s not easily brushed up against or bumped.

thumb.name: Angel Tree Topper
thumb.verse: Make your own angel for the top of your Christmas tree with this easy-to-put-together. 3-D tree-topper project.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EYou'll Need:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPaper. 8 1/2 x 11 inches. preferably heavy cardstock. Scissors. Tape or glue.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3COL%3E%3CLI%3EClick on %3CB%3EPersonalize and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Creative workspace.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3EClick %3Cb%3EPrint Project%3C/b%3E to send finished %3Cb%3ETree Topper%3C/b%3E to the printer. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3ETo assemble the angel%26#146;s skirt. %3Cb%3Eoverlap%3C/b%3E the edges to the solid red line. forming a cone. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3ETape or glue%3C/b%3E together the angel%26#146;s skirt. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3ETo assemble the angel%26#146;s body. %3Cb%3Etape or glue%3C/b%3E together the front and back pieces. Note that there will be some overlap of the two pieces; %3Cb%3Etrim%3C/b%3E excess overlap as needed.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3ETo assemble the wings. %3Cb%3Etape or glue%3C/b%3E together the front and back pieces. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EAttach%3C/b%3E wings to the center. top area of the angel%26#146;s back. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3ETo complete. %3Cb%3Einsert%3C/b%3E assembled angel body into the top opening of the skirt. %3Cb%3Etape or glue%3C/b%3E the angel%26#146;s body to the inside of the angel%26#146;s skirt.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3C/LI%3E%3C/OL%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPrint your project on scrap paper first to check the alignment. spelling. and overall look of the project.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E For extra dazzle at the top of your Christmas tree. sprinkle a light dusting of gold glitter over the angel tree topper before placing on tree.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3EGreat. too. for tabletop and smaller-sized Christmas trees on display in kids%26#146; rooms or hallway areas.

thumb.name: Countdown to Christmas
thumb.verse: Count down to Santa%26#146;s arrival with this cute. easy-to-use Santa Claus Countdown Chart!%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EYou'll Need:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPaper. 8 1/2 x 11 inches. preferably heavy cardstock. Scissors. Glue. 26 Cotton balls.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3COL%3E%3CLI%3EClick on %3CB%3EPersonalize and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Creative workspace.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3EMake text changes as desired.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3EClick %3Cb%3EPrint Project%3C/b%3E to send finished %3Cb%3ECountdown Chart%3C/b%3E to the printer. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EAttach%3C/b%3E one cotton ball to the tip of the hat. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3EOn December 1st. %3Cb%3Etape or glue%3C/b%3E one cotton ball on top of the circle numbered %26#147;25%26#148; on the beard area of the Santa Claus face. The next day. %3Cb%3Etape or glue%3C/b%3E a cotton ball to the top of the circle numbered %26#147;24%26#148;. and on each day that follows. %3Cb%3Econtinue%3C/b%3E to add one cotton ball to the next open circle.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3ESanta arrives the night that you %3Cb%3Eattach%3C/b%3E the last cotton ball. making his beard complete!%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3C/LI%3E%3C/OL%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPrint your project on scrap paper first to check the alignment. spelling. and overall look of the project.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3EUse several holiday magnets or double-stick tape to post the Santa Claus Countdown Chart to the front of the refrigerator.

thumb.name: Holiday 'Coupon' Book
thumb.verse: %3Cb%3ECreat %26 Print%3C/b%3E special %3Cb%3ECoupon Books%3C/b%3E for an extra special gift.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EYou'll Need:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPaper. 8 1/2 x 11 inches. preferably card stock. Scissors. Staples and stapler. or hole punch and string or yarn.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3COL%3E%3CLI%3EClick on %3CB%3EPersonalize and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Creative workspace. %3C/LI%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EPersonalize%3C/b%3E the text. %3Cb%3ESelect%3C/b%3E the text to write over it or to change size. color. and font style.%3C/LI%3E%3CLI%3EClick %3Cb%3EPrint Project%3C/b%3E to send finished %3Cb%3ECoupons%3C/b%3E to the printer. %3C/LI%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3ECut%3C/b%3E out coupon cover and each coupon.%3C/LI%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EStack%3C/b%3E coupons and cover in a neat pile. with coupon cover on top.%3C/LI%3E%3CLI%3EIf using staples to bind coupons and cover together. %3Cb%3Estaple%3C/b%3E coupons and cover along the left side of the pile.%3C/LI%3E%3CLI%3EIf using string to bind coupons and cover together. %3Cb%3Epunch%3C/b%3E three holes along the left side of the pile. and %3Cb%3Ethread and tie%3C/b%3E string or yarn through each hole.%3C/LI%3E%3C/ol%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPrint your project on scrap paper first to check the alignment. spelling. and overall look of the project.

thumb.name: Message for Santa
thumb.verse: Use this delightful and practical doorhanger to leave a note for Santa when he stops by on Christmas Eve!%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EYou'll need:%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3C/B%3E Paper. 8 1/2 x 11 inches. preferably heavy cardstock. Scissors. Glue. Pen or pencil.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CB%3EDirections:%3C/B%3E%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3COL%3E%3CLI%3EClick on %3CB%3EPersonalize and Print Your Project%3C/B%3E to open the Creative workspace. %3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EMake%3C/b%3E text changes as desired.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CLI%3EClick %3Cb%3EPrint Project%3C/b%3E to send finished %3Cb%3EDoorhanger%3C/b%3E to the printer.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3ECut%3C/B%3E along the solid. exterior lines of all three pieces.%3CBR%3E%3CBR%3E%3CLI%3EOn the doorhanger panel. %3Cb%3Ecut%3C/b%3E along solid. white line. toward the round. white center.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3ECut out%3C/b%3E the white center.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3EOn the Santa pocket. %3Cb%3Efold%3C/b%3E white dotted lines.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3ETo assemble doorhanger. %3Cb%3Ewrap%3C/b%3E folded edges of Santa pocket around the back. bottom section of the doorhanger panel.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3EUsing glue or tape. %3Cb%3Esecure%3C/b%3E folded edges of Santa pocket onto the back side of the doorhanger panel. creating a pocket.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EWrite%3C/b%3E your note to Santa Claus on the single sided note card.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EInsert%3C/b%3E note card into the doorhanger pocket.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3CLI%3E%3Cb%3EHang%3C/b%3E doorhanger around doorknob of bedroom or other door Santa will see when he visits your house on Christmas Eve.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3E%3C/LI%3E%3C/OL%3E%3CB%3ETips:%3C/B%3E %3CBR%3E%3CBR%3EPrint your project on scrap paper first to check the alignment. spelling. and overall look of the project.%3Cbr%3E%3Cbr%3EUse the thank-you note as a way to also tell Santa that there are milk and cookies waiting for him on the kitchen table!
